input.project_name: UPM-2844374 - 3600 Steeles Ave East Markham - 2025 Chillers 101, 102 and 103 Tri-Annual service
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work commencement by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (4):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort (6):sor submitted / draft by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes: CBRE Labour:1 Regular hour:  Site Review SOW21 Regular hours: Monito work. CBRE Operations to isolate each unit for service and restore when complete3 Regular hours: CBRE Operations to enable each individual chiller for the vendor to conduct operational checks
scope_of_work.problem: Tri-annual chillers service including gaskets replacement, Eddy current testing of all tubes and Inhibitor flushing.Chiller 101- Condenser vessel tube cleaning Eddy and current testing- Evaporator vessel Tube cleaning and Eddy current testing.Chiller 102- Condenser vessel tube cleaning and Eddy current testing- Evaporator vessel Tube cleaning and Eddy current testing.Chiller 103- Condenser vessel tube cleaning and Eddy current testing- Evaporator vessel Tube cleaning and Eddy current testing.
scope_of_work.scope: Ainsworth and CBRE operations to isolate one chiller at a time for service. Mechanical plant will be maintained at N+1 for the duration of the service of the three High pressure chillers.- Chillers will be isolated electrically (power) and mechanically (Valves) for both Evaporator and Condenser Vessels. Both Vessels will be drained, and End plates removed, all tubes cleaned and Eddy current performed. Once completed, End plates to both vessels will be re-installed and properly torqued, both vessels will be re-filled and inspected for leaks. Ainsworth technician to confirm chiller is fully restored and ready for service.
scope_of_work.justification: Tube Cleaning- Chiller efficiency is affected more by the cleanliness of heat transfer surfaces than any other single factor. Given the fact that a chiller typically can have several miles of tubing making up the condenser and evaporator, it makes sense to keep chiller tubes as clean as possible maintaining good chiller performance and efficiency.Eddy current testingCondenser & Evaporator eddy current tube analysis can identify damaged tubes before they fail, as well as good tubes that don’t need to be replaced. This process is an easy and effective way to diagnose Vessel exchanger failures.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Chillers efficiency could be affected if both Condenser and evaporator tube vessels are not serviced. Chiller efficiency and operation could be impacted due to fouling.

CBRE Operations to isolate each unit for service and restore when complete3 Regular hours: CBRE Operations to enable each individual chiller for the vendor to conduct operational checks. Problem identified: Tri-annual chillers service including gaskets replacement, Eddy current testing of all tubes and Inhibitor flushing.Chiller 101- Condenser vessel tube cleaning Eddy and current testing- Evaporator vessel Tube cleaning and Eddy current testing.Chiller 102- Condenser vessel tube cleaning and Eddy current testing- Evaporator vessel Tube cleaning and Eddy current testing.Chiller 103- Condenser vessel tube cleaning and Eddy current testing- Evaporator vessel Tube cleaning and Eddy current testing.. Scope includes: Ainsworth and CBRE operations to isolate one chiller at a time for service. Mechanical plant will be maintained at N+1 for the duration of the service of the three High pressure chillers.- Chillers will be isolated electrically (power) and mechanically (Valves) for both Evaporator and Condenser Vessels. Both Vessels will be drained, and End plates removed, all tubes cleaned and Eddy current performed. Once completed, End plates to both vessels will be re-installed and properly torqued, both vessels will be re-filled and inspected for leaks. Ainsworth technician to confirm chiller is fully restored and ready for service.. Justification: Tube Cleaning- Chiller efficiency is affected more by the cleanliness of heat transfer surfaces than any other single factor. Given the fact that a chiller typically can have several miles of tubing making up the condenser and evaporator, it makes sense to keep chiller tubes as clean as possible maintaining good chiller performance and efficiency.Eddy current testingCondenser & Evaporator eddy current tube analysis can identify damaged tubes before they fail, as well as good tubes that don’t need to be replaced. This process is an easy and effective way to diagnose Vessel exchanger failures.. Effect if not approved: Chillers efficiency could be affected if both Condenser and evaporator tube vessels are not serviced. Chiller efficiency and operation could be impacted due to fouling..

scope_of_work.notes: 1. Does not include any client contingency2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The Data floor lighting has multiple lights out that cannot be replaced with the current fixtures as they are end of life and not produced anymore. We need to replace raised floor lighting with updated fixtures so there is adequate lighting and not a safety issue.
scope_of_work.scope: Vendor to supply and install new LED fixtures on the raised floor to replace EOL fixtures currently installedCBRE hours: Qualify SOW with Engineers/Vendors, Review with client:  Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 30 minutes Vendor site visit to provide quote:  Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 30 minutes Launch project, create FSP, change ticket, ask access for contractors:  Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 1 hour Monitor Work, help vendor with access to raised floor, perform checks throughout the day, confirm vendor has all QHSE paperwork (1 week to complete this job):  DC Technician / Engineer - 10 hours Verify Work Completed to SOW:  Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 30 minutes
scope_of_work.justification: This is a safety issue as there is now a significant change in the lighting on raised floor. Current fixtures are not able to be repaired or replaced with like for like fixtures.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work commencement by Sebastian Vandervort (4):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (6):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort (7):sor submitted / draft by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes: CBRE Labour:2 Regular hours:  monitor vendor and complete required QHSE docs1 Regular hours:  Verify Work Completed to SOW
scope_of_work.problem: STS 2B2 screen has failed and requires a replacement. In the event there is a loss of the preferred source, it will switch to the alternate. Once the preferred source returns there is no way to restore to that source without screen operation. The annual maintenance cannot be completed until the screen is repaired because the screen operation is required to perform test transfers.
scope_of_work.scope: The OEM will supply and install the screen. The STS must be placed in bypass to source 1 status to replace the screen. Once replaced test transfers will be completed between both sources before restoring to normal.
scope_of_work.justification: Transfers from one source to the other are not possible without replacing the screen. The annual PM is also not doable.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Transfers from one source to the other are not possible without replacing the screen. The annual PM is also not doable.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work commencement by Sebastian Vandervort (4):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer approved by Sebastian Vandervort (6):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort (7):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort (8):sor submitted / draft by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes: CBRE Labour:1 Regular hours: Vendor Site Visits16 Regular hours: Monitor Work1 Regular hour: Verify Work Completed to SOW
scope_of_work.problem: Reason for the Uplift: To add  refrigerant required after leak check and repair was completed- 655lbs R134a.Chiller 103 incurred a refrigerant leak at the solenoid valve. Chiller shutdown due to a low pressure condition. Solenoid is now isolated and chiller is offline. New solenoid and gaskets will be required with addition refrigerant to be added.
scope_of_work.scope: Vendor will recover the refrigerant charge and weigh it to tabulate total refrigerant loss. A new solenoid and gaskets will be installed and machine charged with recovered refrigerant. Additional cost of required refrigerant will be added after the chiller is repaired. additional quote will be provided to top-up unit
scope_of_work.justification: Chiller is currently isolated and faulty solenoid also isolated to prevent further refrigerant loss. Chiller will not operate due to low pressure condition until its repaired.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Chiller is unable to operate in the current condition.

input.project_name: UPM-2846099 - 3600 Steeles Ave East Markham - G4  F4 VESDA PANELS BATTERIES REPLACEMENT
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Sebastian Vandervort (2):work order closed by Sebastian Vandervort (3):work commencement by Sebastian Vandervort (4):work planning by Sebastian Vandervort (5):offer approved (6):offer submitted by Sebastian Vandervort (7):sor submitted / draft by Sebastian Vandervort

scope_of_work.notes: CBRE Labour: 4 Regular hours:  Ensure Fire panel is bypassed / provide access to VESDA Panels for Batteries replacement0.5 Regular Hours:  Ensure full completion of install / restore fire panel / Vendor sign-off
scope_of_work.problem: CBRE Operations with Vendor (VIPOND) to replace controlled power Batteries located in F4, G4 and Electrical rooms inside the VESDA control cabinets.. Replacement to take place due to its age and years of service.  360 solutions. to properly recycle all used batteries extracted and provide disposal certification
scope_of_work.scope: CBRE with VIPOND to bypass both F4 and G4 Vesda system for the duration of batteries replacement.  Once completed Fire system will be restored and back to full monitoring, free of alarms
scope_of_work.justification: VRLA batteries in these particular modules are recommended for replacement at a range of 3 - 5 years of service, This battery system with age loses its ability to maintain greater than 80% capacity, Replacement is recommended. The reason for the strict set of rules governing the disposal of batteries is that lead-acid batteries are largely composed of 60-75% [by weight] lead [Pb], lead-dioxide [PbO2] and a sulfuric acid solution electrolyte. This heavy metal element makes them toxic and improper disposal can be hazardous to the environment. Improper and illegal disposal of lead-acid batteries show up in the form of pollution of our drinking water, and food produced from ingredients exposed to small and moderate levels of lead content
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: As these batteries age, a decline on its rating is also impacted. This decline could be a result of internal corrosion and expansion of the plate grids, possible drying of the electrolytes. Naturally the batteries no longer will support the load as per its design specs.

scope_of_work.problem: Multiple issues were brought up relating to diesel fire pump at WLDC during the annual PM
scope_of_work.scope: • No check valve is present in the fuel return line, one must be installed.o Supply and install a ½” check valve on the fuel return line.• Coolant is black in colour.o Coolant requires flush and install new coolant.• Cooling loop pressure gauge was at 42 psi as found, unit not running.o New cooling loop pressure gauge required, 0-60 psi gauge.• The alarm bell does not ring when alarm is active.o Supply and install a new bell required.• Front pump packing is leaking excessively.o Adjusting nuts are seized hardware will need to be replaced supply andinstall new packing utilizing fire pump specialty company Delta Arndt.CBRE hours:Qualify SOW with Engineers/Vendors, Review with client: Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 30 minutesCreate change ticket, complete scheduling, confirm security access: Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 30 minutesMonitor Work: DC Technician / Engineer - 6 hours ( work to be completed over 8 hour day. Fire pump shutdown needed, fire monitoring throughout the day, operations to check up on vendor- complete testing at end of repairs)Verify Work Completed to SOW: Snr Engineer / Supervisor - 30 minutes (confirm all work completed, review service report)
scope_of_work.justification: This is critical part of fire safety systems and needs to be in working order
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Possible failure of fire safety systems
